segment.source: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console

segment.source: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console

segment.source: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console
segment.target: How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console

segment.source: Use the following procedure to publish an App-V 5.0 package.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to publish an App-V 5.0 package.

segment.source: Once you publish a package, computers that are running the App-V 5.0 client can access and run the applications in that package.
segment.target: Once you publish a package, computers that are running the App-V 5.0 client can access and run the applications in that package.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The ability to enable only administrators to publish or unpublish packages (described below) is supported starting in App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: The ability to enable only administrators to publish or unpublish packages (described below) is supported starting in App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: To publish an App-V 5.0 package
segment.target: To publish an App-V 5.0 package

segment.source: In the App-V 5.0 Management console.
segment.target: In the App-V 5.0 Management console.

segment.source: right-click the name of the package to be published, and select Publish.
segment.target: right-click the name of the package to be published, and select Publish.

segment.source: Review the Status column to verify that the package has been published and is now available.
segment.target: Review the Status column to verify that the package has been published and is now available.

segment.source: If the package is available, the status published is displayed.
segment.target: If the package is available, the status published is displayed.

segment.source: If the package is not published successfully, the status unpublished is displayed, along with error text that explains why the package is not available.
segment.target: If the package is not published successfully, the status unpublished is displayed, along with error text that explains why the package is not available.

segment.source: To enable only administrators to publish or unpublish packages
segment.target: To enable only administrators to publish or unpublish packages

segment.source: Navigate to the following Group Policy Object node:
segment.target: Navigate to the following Group Policy Object node:

segment.source: Computer Configuration Policies Administrative Templates System App-V Publishing.
segment.target: Computer Configuration Policies Administrative Templates System App-V Publishing.

segment.source: Enable the Require publish as administrator Group Policy setting.
segment.target: Enable the Require publish as administrator Group Policy setting.

segment.source: To alternatively use PowerShell to set this item, see How to Manage App-V 5.0 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: To alternatively use PowerShell to set this item, see How to Manage App-V 5.0 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.target: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
